1.description: Simply a starting page describing what we'll do in this lab
1.directions: In this lab, you will learn how to use an analytical balance to prepare a standard stock solution

2.description: Page showing powder sample and explaining how our task is to weigh around 0.5 g of that powder sample and create a standard stock solution
2.directions: Our task is to weight around 0.5g of the powder sample.

3.description: Take out all the correct apparatus and chemicals neeed from the cabinet
3.directions: First of all, take out all the apparatus needed for the lab from the cabinet.

userAnswers: [DYNAMICALLY UPDATE WITH USER'S SELECTIONS AND UPDATE COUNT EACH TIME USER CHOOSES INCORRECT OPTION]

4.description: Animation showing us opening the side window of the analytical balance.
4.directions: Next, open the side window of the analytical balance.
4.user_instructions: Click on the balance's side door that is to your right to open it.

5.description: Animation showing us obtaining and folding a weighing paper in half.
5.directions: Obtain a weighing paper and fold it diagonally.
5.user_instructions: Click the weighing paper to fold it.

6.description: A balance with the side window open with a folder filter paper inside it.
6.directions: Next, place the weighing paper onto the balance.

7.stepTitle: Add Powder Sample Onto Weighing Paper
7.description: Add the appropriate amount of powder sample onto the weighing paper that is still on the balance.
7.directions: Add around 0.5g of powder sample. Notice the balance reading as you do so.
7.user_instructions: Use the buttons to add/remove powder sample.

8.description: Animation showing us closing the side window of the analytical balance.
8.directions: After adding powder, close the side window of the balance.
8.user_instructions: Click the side door to close it.

9.stepTitle: Reading Weight of Powder Sample and Weighing Paper
9.description: User anwers the stabilized reading onto the number pad.
9.directions: What is the reading of the powder sample with weighing paper? Put your answer in the box below.

10.stepTitle: Transfer Sample Powder Into Clean Beaker
10.description: Animation showing us adding the sample powder from a diagonally folded filter paper into a beaker.
10.directions: Transfer the sample powder into a clean beaker and place the paper back into the balance.

11.description: User anwers the stabilized reading onto the number pad.
11.directions: What is the reading of the weighing paper? Please input your answer in the box.

12.stepTitle: Calculating Net Weight of Sample Powder
12.description: User anwers the net weight of the sample powder obtained onto the number pad.
12.directions: What is the net weight of the sample powder obtained?

13.description: User adds a small amount of distilled water to the beaker to dissolve the sample
13.directions: Add enough water to the beaker and stir with the bar until the sample is dissolved.

14.stepTitle: Transfering the Solution to a Flask
14.description: User transfers the solution from a beaker to a Flask
14.directions: Transfer the solution from the beaker to the flask.

15.description: User checks the beaker for residue, and if there is residue, rinse again with a small amount of water
15.directions: Check the beaker. If there is sample residue, rinse the beaker again. Otherwise, continue.

16.stepTitle: Adding Water to Dilute the Solution
16.description: User adds distilled water to the flask to dilute the solution
16.directions: Add water until bottom of the miniscus reaches the line on the flask (do not go over!). Notice the white tile in the background to make the line more noticeable!

17.description: User adds distilled water to the flask using an eyedropper
17.directions: Add water using a dropper to finish reaching the line.

18.stepTitle: Adding the Stopper and Mixing the Solution
18.description: User adds a stopper and rotates the flask to mix the solution
18.directions: Attach the stopper to the flask and rotate the flask to mix the solution.

19.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
19.directions: Congratulations! You have finished the lab. We hope you enjoyed it!
